intro: Euphorbiodendron cubense, commonly known as Cuban euphorbia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Cuba. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their diverse morphology and ecological roles. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, characterized by its thick, succulent stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia, a feature common in the Euphorbiaceae family. Euphorbiodendron cubense is adapted to tropical climates and is often found in dry, limestone-rich soils.
